Thousands of Minnesotans took to the streets in subzero temperatures to protest the Trump administration’s aggressive immigration enforcement and deadly confrontations involving federal agents.

Nobel Laureate Roy Glauber says science is guesswork, not perfect logic
description: Roy Glauber, the physicist who won the 2005 Nobel Prize in Physics, challenged a core assumption about how science works. In interviews reflecting on his career, Glauber argued that real scientific breakthroughs rarely emerge from strict deduction. Instead, they grow out of intuition, guesswork, and sustained curiosity. His reflections offer a powerful career lesson for young scientists and educators, questioning how science is taught and how creativity truly enters research.

title: Hyderabad godown fire: 3 dead, rescue operations underway; showroom owner on run
description: A calamity unfolded in Nampally as a fierce blaze erupted, taking the lives of three victims and leaving five others potentially trapped in the ominous depths of a cellar. This inferno, sparked by combustible materials, ravaged a local furniture showroom, with rescue efforts hampered by suffocating smoke and extreme heat.

This move aims to bolster domestic rare earth production, with the company also securing $1 billion in private funding. The investment includes government shares and warrants, priced near the company's recent trading levels.

title: Music composer and singer Abhijit Majumdar passes away at 54
description: Renowned music composer and singer Abhijit Majumdar passed away at 54 after a prolonged illness at AIIMS Bhubaneswar. He was admitted in September last year with a neurological disorder and multiple comorbid conditions. Despite initial recovery and plans for discharge, he succumbed to refractory septic shock and cardiac arrest on Sunday.

The day aims to recognise voters, encourage youth participation, reinforce democratic values, and promote universal adult suffrage. In a post on X, the Prime Minister said National Voters’ Day is about “further deepening our faith in the democratic values of our nation”.

Carrying a Rs 25,000 bounty, his arrest brings the total to seven. Police also sealed five linked gyms. The racket targeted young women, using morphed content for blackmail and conversion pressure.

title: 'What did you just do!' Second killing in Minneapolis by US federal agents - video captures horror

Footage shows officers tackling Pretti, who was holding a phone, and firing multiple shots even after he collapsed. Officials claim Pretti violently resisted disarming, but his family describes him as a caring nurse.

title: 'Simple guy, never got angry': College teacher stabbed to death on Mumbai local
description: A college teacher was tragically murdered on a local train at Malad station. An argument over alighting led to the fatal stabbing. The Government Railway Police have arrested Omkar Shinde in connection with the incident. The victim, Alok Kumar Singh, was a faculty member at Narsee Monjee College. Investigations are ongoing, with police examining CCTV footage and witness statements.

Bhut, inspired by Jadeja, credited his hero's guidance for his match-winning performance and fulfilling a childhood dream of playing alongside him.

title: Travis Kelce shaken as Taylor Swift reportedly puts wedding plans on hold
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce might have a lot to deal with in their lives over the last few weeks. Amid all the mess, there have been reports of their wedding being “put on hold” as Taylor Swift is focusing on being there for Travis Kelce after a pretty poor season on the field. But it seems, Travis Kelce is not doing well emotionally.

title: 70-year-old Odisha man cycles 600km to take ailing wife to hospital in rickshaw
description: A 70-year-old man in Odisha pedalled his rickshaw van 300 km to take his wife for medical treatment and is now returning home the same way, refusing help. His unwavering devotion highlights the struggles of the poor in accessing healthcare and transport, a story that has gained significant attention.

title: When will Alex Honnold’s dangerous Taipei 101 climb stream live on Netflix?
description: Alex Honnold will climb Taipei 101 live on Netflix on Saturday, Jan. 24, at 8 p.m. ET. The event, called “Skyscraper Live,” was delayed due to weather in Taiwan. Viewers can watch the full ropeless climb only on Netflix, featuring one of the world’s tallest buildings.

title: NBA postpones Warriors-Timberwolves over Minneapolis shooting
description: A fatal shooting involving federal agents in Minneapolis has led to the postponement of the Golden State Warriors vs. Minnesota Timberwolves game. The incident, which occurred Saturday morning, prompted the NBA's decision to reschedule the match for Sunday. This marks the third such encounter with federal officers in Minnesota this month.

title: Rajasthan focuses on higher mining revenue targets in financial year-end

title: Heavy snowfall in Himachal: 685 roads closed, hundreds of tourists stranded
description: Himachal Pradesh grapples with severe disruption as heavy snowfall paralyzes transport, power, and water supply across multiple districts. Lahaul and Spiti remains cut off, with hundreds of tourists stranded in Manali. Authorities are working on a war footing to clear roads and restore essential services amidst freezing temperatures and significant snowfall in popular tourist spots.

Supreme Court judge slams collegium for transfer on government nudge
description: Supreme Court Justice Ujjal Bhuyan voiced strong dissent over the collegium's decision to transfer Justice Atul Sreedharan, citing executive influence. He argued that such transfers, especially when prompted by the central government, compromise judicial independence and the integrity of the collegium system. Justice Bhuyan emphasized the judiciary's reliance on public faith.

A viral plea for him to apologize to 'Justin' on his podcast has ignited widespread demand for accountability. Notably, some Swifties are joining the chorus, questioning the situation's handling, a shift that amplifies the online discourse and Kelce's continued silence.

title: 'She stopped crying to survive': Father beats 4-year-old to death over maths homework
description: A four-year-old girl in Faridabad was allegedly beaten to death by her father for a math assignment error. Neighbors reported the father, a private firm employee, frequently abused the child when drunk. The girl, Vanshika Jaiswal, was reportedly conditioned to avoid crying in front of him due to his violent reactions.

title: Mumbai Police books Vikram Bhatt, daughter in Rs 13.5 crore cheating case
description: Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt and his daughter Krishna Bhatt are facing a new fraud case in Mumbai, accused of cheating a Pune-based investor out of Rs 13.5 crore. How to 'walk' your way out of diabetes, high BP?
description: A sedentary lifestyle is fueling a health crisis, but a simple solution exists: walking. Experts emphasize that regular, brisk walking, even for shorter durations, significantly improves blood sugar, blood pressure, and overall well-being.  This accessible activity can even lead to remission for pre-diabetes and enhance medication effectiveness for existing conditions.

title: Infosys asks employees to share home electricity bill data; here’s why
description: Infosys is now collecting household electricity data from employees working remotely to enhance its sustainability efforts. This initiative aims to accurately measure the environmental impact of hybrid work and refine clean energy strategies. The company, already a leader in renewable energy sourcing, seeks to further reduce its carbon footprint by understanding home energy consumption patterns.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet urges hands-on learning; cites 300 leaders trained
description: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: Buffalo Bills fans rally to bring back ex-coach Sean McDermott after firing
description: A passionate Buffalo Bills fan, Maria Maisonet, created a Change.org petition to reinstate head coach Sean McDermott, accumulating over 45,000 signatures. The fan believes McDermott’s dismissal is short-sighted, overlooking his contributions and player respect. She argues McDermott deserves a chance to coach in the new stadium [New Highmark Stadium]. Bills owner Terry Pegula sensed something in the locker room, which led to McDermott’s firing.

title: Amazon layoffs 'announced'; company set to cut thousands of jobs
description: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: Doctor's advice on common traps: Dr Ankur Gahlot warns about hidden
description: Diabetes management often feels like a battle due to common lifestyle traps and misinformation, not necessarily the disease's inherent difficulty. Experts highlight that irregular routines, misconceptions about 'healthy' foods like fruit juices, and lack of consistent physical activity significantly impact blood sugar control. Understanding these pitfalls is key to avoiding constant struggle.
